title: Shen needs an energy buff to make him similar to his fellow Ninja's
body:
This represents a full rotation of spells but does not include auto attacks.
Energy values represent what can be potentially refunded

Level 1 
Akali - 200 Energy/ Refund 20 energy
Zed - **165** Energy/ Refund 20 energy
Kennen - 210 Energy / Refund 40 energy
Shen - 210 Energy/ Refund 40 - 200 energy and 10 with Ki Strike
Lee Sin - 150 Energy| 240 Energy / Refund 15-30 Energy

Level 18
Akali - 160 Energy/ Refund 40 energy
Zed - **125** Energy/ Refund 40 energy
Kennen - 170 Energy / Refund 40 energy
Shen - 210 Energy/ Refund 40 - 200 energy and 30 with Ki Strike
Lee Sin - 150 Energy| 240 Energy / Refund 15-30 Energy

Edit: Added Lee Sin
Where as all other Ninja's have energy costs that are reduced with level Shen doesn't and this really hurts his mid-late game. He is not able to use the one of his two other abilities if his taunt misses and it's rare for him to get into auto attack in to refund energy. All other mages don't need rely on 1 ability hitting to do a full rotation of abilities. And for late game they can use 4 abilities not including there ults with no energy refund necessary, whereas Shen is crippled if he misses his narrow ass taunt. 

All I am saying is that there is no need for him to have so many weaknesses compared to other champions.

Bonus Video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qnZ0gIm5Drc&feature=gp-n-y&google_comment_id=z13djp4yrk2jf5rhv04cdpzivp2zt5gjs20

They need to move Shen's refund off of his taunt because it's too punishing if he misses. I think they should keep the Ki Strike refund and move the taunt bonus over to Feint but reduce it. So something like refund 20 energy if Feint's shield breaks, but no longer refund anything from Shadow Dash.

Try him in the jungle, he's actually pretty fun and useful there.  You won't have to worry about losing lane because an emergency happens and you ult in to help someone, he has decent ganks once he hits three and his regen actually makes it so you can gank with 3/4 health (Or even full if you go after a scuttle crab), and it works well with his ultimate since junglers are supposed to be watching the map anyway to look for trouble to stop and weaves to snatch. 

You can stop things from going bad or snowball your lanes pretty nicely as long as no one starts feeding horribly from my experience so far and since you're a tank anyway you don't really need the kills to help everyone out.

That said, increased energy regen would be nice on him. At least a little bit.

Shen needs help. I think it's gotta be more than just energy costs though.

I think that outside of his ultimate, he just isn't fun to play, and that should change.
Shen has high energy costs because if his costs were on par with the other ninjas, he would be absolutely god tier. His kit has WAY more strengths than the other kits.

How so? 
CC Wise: His taunt has a tiny radius and does 0 damage compared to Kennen's Massive AOE Stun which scales on what he builds.
Damage Wise: Everyone does more damage than him
Tank Wise: Lee Sin effectively Tanks better due to his mobility and also has better sustain with his Iron Will
Mobility: See everyone else

1. you are comparing an ultimate with a 120 second cooldown to a basic ability with a 16-8 second cooldown.

2. Shen actually bursts pretty hard with a Trinity Force. trinity force is actually really good because his Q and W have low CDs and can be cast indefinitely the moment they come off of CD. And the damage from Sunfire cape actually adds up to a lot given how tanky Shen is.

3. Lee sin becomes useless outside of his 90 second cooldown ultimate if you build him full tank for lategame. Also Shen sustains way better than Lee sin due to the spammability of Q and W.

4. I'm pretty certain a global ultimate that also comes with a massive shield is not "bad mobility". Also the shield is massive and makes him the best counterganker in the game post 6.

Shen's weaknesses  (for a top laner) are: his lack of aoe damage and obvious lack of waveclear because of it (which is why he builds Sunfire cape, (or the new bami's cinder, which btw is a huge buff to Shen))
He has no early game kill potential/burst. You kill your enemy by harassing them with Q and outsustaining them in a battle of attrition that you will win because shen is a massive meatwall early game (lategame he is also a big meatwall).

That being said, like Renekton, he has everything a top laner wants outside of those weaknesses. And unlike Renekton he's actually pretty great lategame because of his ult/splitpush strength.
Shen actually got played in the LCS by H2K because of the Bami's Cinder buff
my problem with Shen is that you aren't allowed to use 2 (vorpal blade and feint) of your abilities if you want to use your most important one, (shadow dash), yet it can be interrupted by a love tap.

I've played with scaling energy runes and like 4 seals & 2 glyphs and it was pretty good. Best if your getting some ap and cdr like rylais and can spam your shield for more tankyness. Its also handy if your low on energy and need to dash away waiting isn't as long mid to late game though once the runes kick in. 

Here's my idea for shen to get better energy management since missing a taunt is pverly costly considering how narrow. I'd be like nidalee losing 15% mana for missing a spear. 
 http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/KL0NuLWE-possible-fix-for-shen-taunt-width

I also had this suggestion. http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/12h9HwVK-shen-feint-and-ki-strike-interaction

This would also help him a lot in the jungle especially if going full tank and relies on passive to clear. It will be a bit more like Lee sin where a good shen makes good use of spells to clear faster. By leveling feint up enough to keep it up in the jungle while auto attacking you could clear faster than spamming q. 

In fact this could actually be considered a bug of sorts. Since feint is supposed to shave 2 seconds off kistrike cool down. If your at 1 second on it your getting chipped/ not getting the full efficacy of feint while its up. It should sort of round up sort to speak to and trigger kistrike.
shen needs a new kit.
He doesn't need a whole new kit, maybe just a better identity because he doesn't feel like a ninja

I feel that Shen does feel like a ninja, just not the exact same archetype as Zed.  Shen is an honorable ninja who leaps from the shadows to defend his allies, using his martial skill to deflect his opponents attacks and incapacitate them.  In my opinion, if there is anything holding Shen back from feeling like a ninja, it is his ridiculously low base movement speed.  He should have his movement speed increased by 10 points to equal Zed's.

If Shen gets a rework, I think it should be extremely minimal.  I do support making his Feint seem more ninja-esque though.  It would be awesome if he blocked/dodged his opponents attacks for 1 second or so (maybe regaining energy based on the damage prevented?) rather than generating a shield.  It would feel pretty sweet to outplay a stacked Nasus by blocking their Siphoning Strike and using the damage to regain full energy.
